Problem:
Consider a system governed by a complex function \\( z(t) = x(t) + iy(t) \\), where \\( x(t) \\) and \\( y(t) \\) are real-valued functions and \\( i \\) is the imaginary unit. The effect of an integral transformation \\( T \\) defined by \\( Tz(t) = \\int_0^t e^{-s}z(s) ds \\) over time \\( t \\) is studied.

Can we determine the initial function \\( z(0) \\) just by observing \\( z(T) \\) at a later time \\( T \\) without knowing if the transformation \\( T \\) was applied?
Explanation: Without explicit knowledge of the application or non-application of \\( T \\), reconstructing \\( z(0) \\) is not feasible. The transformation could alter initial conditions significantly, hindering the accurate back-calculation from \\( z(T) \\) to \\( z(0) \\).
